title: TC001-Verify web scraper collects data from Instagram and public sites
description: Test that the web scraping collector successfully acquires up-to-date arts and culture event and grant data from Instagram and configured public sites, and handles pagination and rate limits properly.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Trigger the web scraping collector module manually or via scheduled job.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click ë¡œê·¸ì¸ (Login) to check if there is an admin or collector trigger option after login.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/header/div/div/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Data Collection Successful').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test failed: The web scraping collector did not successfully acquire up-to-date arts and culture event and grant data from Instagram and configured public sites, or failed to handle pagination and rate limits properly.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

        # -> Apply combination filters including genre, region, and source to test filtering functionality.
        frame = context.pages[-1]

        frame = context.pages[-1]

        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)

            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed

                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow

        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/header/div/div/a').nth(0)

code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Click ë¡œê·¸ì¸ (login) to access user account features for subscription setup.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click ë¡œê·¸ì¸ (login) to access user account features for subscription setup
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/header/div/div/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Telegram Alert: New Grant Notification').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test failed: The integrated Telegram alert system did not send timely notifications to subscribed users about new or updated grants/events as expected.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

    pw = None

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments

                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Send valid API requests to all public and admin backend API endpoints to verify response times and data formats.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3000/api/public/events', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Identify correct public and admin API endpoints for testing.

        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Explore the main frontend UI to find clues or links to API endpoints or documentation, or check for network calls during UI interactions to identify backend API endpoints.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3000', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Click the search button to trigger API calls and capture network requests to identify backend API endpoints for testing.

        # --> Assertions to verify final state

        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: Backend API endpoints did not meet SLA response times or returned incorrect data formats or error messages as per the test plan.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:

        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

title: TC010-Empty state UI and error state display on frontend
description: Validate frontend displays appropriate UI feedback when no search results match, or when data loading or error states occur.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Perform a search with criteria that matches no events or grants.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input search text that matches no events or grants
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/section/div[2]/div/form/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('NoSuchEventXYZ')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the search button to perform the search
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/header/div/div/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Search results found')).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: The frontend did not display the expected empty state message or UI feedback when no search results matched the criteria, or during loading/error states as per the test plan.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
